title: How do I stop firefox from putting visited pages on shortcuts bar?
content:
Hiya,

New Tab / Home Page > The handy "Shortcuts" Bar >

How do I make it so it's only sites I WANT there, aka sites I've saved? I'm tired of it just filling this bar up with random pages I visit once or twice.

I want it to just be shortcuts I CHOOSE.

I KNOW that I can keep clicking 'dismiss' on the unwanted shortcuts, BUT I SHOULDN'T HAVE TO.

TIA
creator: miss.wigglebutt

title: Recovery Key
content:
I recently set up Firefox Recovery Keys knowing that I was formatting my PC. I am logged into my Firefox account on my laptop and have forgotten my password. Using Firefox Sync and Google Authenticator, I can log into Firefox on my Android.

I am trying to log into Firefox on my PC now, and have forgotten my password, and now none of the Recovery Keys I was given by Firefox are working (I am correct in saying these keys are 10 digits long, and you are given multiple keys when setting up the Recovery Keys?).

I cannot reset my password and lose all of my generated logins. Is there any other way to log into Firefox on desktop, say using google authentication or sync like android?
creator: LiamThom96

title: Richiesta informazioni
content: Salve non riesco a disconnettere altri PC dal mio account...

creator: flamr0342

title: "allow cookies to be stored on this device" warning, but cookies are enabled
content:
Hi there, I have a strange behavior in firefox: when navigating to Yeastar support website (https://support.yeastar.com/hc/en-us) and trying to sign in, i receive the following message: "To continue signing in using Firefox, allow cookies to be stored on this device. You might see this screen more than once. " If I put my username and passwords, I am unable to press the "Sign in" button. If I do the same from an incognito session, the message doesn't appear and I am able to log in through the "Sign in" button (see attached screenshot).

I tried to read many articles about allowing cookies from the firefox documentation but none has solved my problem. I'm running Firefox version 91.0 from a VDI (Citrix Desktop) and I have no admin privileges. Is there anything I can set in order to resolve this problem?
creator: matteo.rizzini

title: Safe Search Filter
content: Hello. I want to find what level of search filtering is being as default by Firefox. All other browsers I have seen allow users to select "No Filter", "Medium Level Filter" or "Safe/Restricted Filter." I have also seen it called "Restriction Level." Where may I find the page to make this simple and common change? Thank you!

content: Having problems with video buffering on Facebook. Works just fine on YouTube. Video starts and stops during entire playback. This has been the case since I loaded FireFox and ran it the first time.

title: Sync tab and Restore previous session
content: Whenever I restore previous session, off bootup or opening firefox with tabs being sent from another device loading in, restoring closes the tabs I just recieved and they don't show in their recent history since they didn't fully load. It happens every once in a while with me being mindless, but would be nice QoL when its a loaded webpage from an app on the phone I then send to the computer that gets lost and has no form of history.
creator: jacobschlimmer

title: How to reset Firefox on my laptop from my android mobile device.
content:
regards,

The Firefox app on laptops and handsets runs very well. well synced too.

the problems I experienced were: when my laptop was damaged and had to enter the service center, I didn't have time to reset the browser. there are many passwords there. logging out of the device in the account settings menu from my android handset likely only stops the browser on the laptop from syncing with the handset, but does not delete the passwords already stored on the laptop Firefox app. (i've tried it on my desktop PC).

thanks in advance for the help.
creator: ilhamfird

title: Youtube resolution
content: Firefox forcefully downloading Youtube videos in 4K if available. I'm using also Chrome and Opera browsers and this is Firefox-issue only. Changing resolution does not work, it going back to 4K immediately. My PC is capable only for 1080p and my internet connection is not fast enough either. This makes Firefox mostly useless for watching Youtube because most new vids are 4K. I have looked at the settings from both Youtube and Firefox and I can't see anything wrong there.
creator: jyrimtlaitinen
